title: Blue-collar worker
summary: A blue-collar worker is a working class person who performs manual labor.  Blue-collar work may involve skilled or unskilled labor. The type of work may involve manufacturing, warehousing, mining, excavation, electricity generation and power plant operations, electrical construction and maintenance, custodial work, farming, commercial fishing, logging, landscaping, pest control, food processing, oil field work, waste collection and disposal, recycling, construction, maintenance. This does exclude driving, trucking and many other types of physical work. Blue-collar work often involves something being physically built or maintained.
